abstracts.cdata!:
The main development objective of the
            Fourth Rural Water Supply and Sanitation Project is the
            rapid increase of water supply and sanitation coverage in
            the rural areas. The secondary development objective is to
            modify the National Environment Sanitation Service's
            (SENASA) role in the sector from an implementer of projects
            to an efficiently managed promoter of activities.  The first
            of four components consists of three subcomponents: 1) New
            water systems built, basically consisting of a deep well, an
            elevated tank and a distribution network of primary and/or
            secondary networks. 2) The production, storage, and
            distribution systems of ten existing systems will be
            expanded. 3) New   systems in the department of Chaco will
            be constructed to supply water to indigenous systems.  The
            second component consists of two subcomponents: sewage
            systems -where the communities have grown and there are
            serious environmental problems from the lack of sanitation-
            and the construction and distribution of concrete slabs for
            latrines will be financed. The third component includes the
            following subcomponents: institutional strengthening of
            SENASA and newly formed Juntas by financing professional,
            technical, and community training, and strengthening the
            environmental management capability of SENASA; designing a
            pilot program and building incentives for private providers
            (Aguaterias); promotion of associations of Juntas; and
            planing a National Rural Water and Sanitation Program.
            Project component four consists of engineering design for
            all of the systems; community mobilization and promotion;
            supervision of the various civil works; and administration
            and monitoring by SENASA and staff; and analyzing the
            project's environmental impact.
